bullets.text: U.S. Black Friday online spending hit $11.8B, defying economic worries and tariffs, signaling resilient consumer demand into the holidays.
Fed hawks and doves spar over December rate cuts; jobs data, inflation expectations, and financial conditions will decide, keeping policy and markets uncertain.
Silver hit record highs in 2025 on solar, electronics and safe-haven demand; analysts see further upside amid supply constraints.
Airbus orders software fix for thousands of jets over solar radiation risk; airlines report disruptions, though some fleets report remediation completed.
U.S. closes Venezuelan airspace, escalating pressure on Maduro and risking aviation, trade and energy logistics disruptions in the region.
Trump plans to pardon convicted Honduran ex-president Hernández, undercutting anti-narcotics messaging and complicating regional security partnerships.
Top Trump aides will meet Ukrainian officials in Florida, signaling backchannel diplomacy that could shape U.S.-Ukraine policy and aid trajectory.
F.D.A. seeks tighter oversight of vaccine trials and approvals after safety lapses, likely extending timelines and compliance costs for biopharma.
Researchers report potential dark matter signal after decades of null results; confirmation would transform fundamental physics and astrophysics.
Hidden blood molecules show strong anti-aging effects in animals, highlighting promising therapeutic targets for longevity biotech.
New York targets personalized pricing with new law, forcing transparency and limits on algorithmic price discrimination in retail and e-commerce.
OpenAI preparing ads for ChatGPT, signaling shift toward ad-supported AI and new monetization dynamics that could impact user experience and competitors.
